meanings.definition: To make an indirect reference or suggestion.
meanings.sent1: She would often allude to her favorite book without mentioning its title.
meanings.sent2: The speaker would allude to upcoming changes in the company during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: He would allude to his secret project with a sly smile.
meanings.sent4: The painting alludes to a famous historical event in a subtle way.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes would allude to her true feelings, even when she remained silent.

meanings.definition: To hint at something without explicitly stating it.
meanings.sent1: The detective would allude to the suspect's guilt without accusing directly.
meanings.sent2: The teacher would allude to the upcoming test to remind the students to study.
meanings.sent3: The cat would allude to its hunger by meowing loudly near its food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds allude to an approaching storm on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph alludes to a forgotten memory from long ago.
